Join us congratulating Principal Michael Calvanese and Educator Marguerite Foster-Franklin as they were recognized this past weekend by Parent Villages as Unsung Heroes.

Calvanese was honored with the Administrator of the Year Award. He is the Executive Principal overseeing Duggan Academy, Kennedy Academy, and The Academy at Kiley. In 2019, Duggan Academy was one of two schools in the state of Massachusetts to exit Level 4 Performance status. This year marks his first year as Executive Principal of three schools.

Foster-Franklin was honored with the Educator in Action Award. She has been an educator for 43 years, serving as a kindergarten teacher at Sumner Avenue School. She is a distinguished community service leader, serving on committees such as C-3, Parent Teacher Home School project, Springfield Girl Friends, Inc., and Springfield Museums.

Watch their tribute at the following YouTube link: https://youtu.be/CurKeNfHJQM

Springfield Conservatory of the Arts is launching an Innovation Pathway in Information that will serve 84 students when fully enrolled. The school is partnering with MassHire Hampden, multiple area industry organizations, and Springfield Technical Community College (STCC) in the development of a curriculum that provides integrated instruction and credential preparation aligned to the Information sector. Students will complete a capstone project designed to address a challenging issue the student identifies.

We might be far in distance, but we remain close in our hearts. Join us celebrating our paras as today is National Paraprofessional Appreciation Day!

Paraprofessional Appreciation Day honors paraprofessional educators, who may also be known as paras. At Springfield Public Schools, Paraprofessionals provide assistance to teachers and other school personnel in the delivery of quality education and support services for students in an array of classroom settings. Examples of support services and educational settings include, but are not limited to: life skills, developmental classrooms, social, emotional, & behavioral support (SEBS), LINKS (Autism) program, visual or mobility orientation, language learning delays, and medical care.
